studyDesigns.name: Study Design 1
studyDesigns.label: USDM Example Study Design
studyDesigns.description: The main design for the study

population.name: POP1
population.description: Patients with Probable Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease

endpoints.name: END1
endpoints.text: Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale, total of 11 items [ADAS-Cog (11)] at Week 24

endpoints.name: END2
endpoints.text: Video-referenced Clinician’s Interview-based Impression of Change (CIBIC+) at Week 24

objectives.name: OBJ1
objectives.text: To determine if there is a statistically significant relationship (overall Type 1 erroralpha=0.05) between the change in both the ADAS-Cog (11) and CIBIC+ scores, and drug dose (0, 50 cm2 [54 mg], and 75 cm2 [81 mg]).

endpoints.name: END4
endpoints.text: Vital signs (weight, standing and supine blood pressure, heart rate)

endpoints.name: END5
endpoints.description: The change from baseline laboratory value will be  calculated as the difference between the baseline lab value and the endpoint value (i.e., the value at the specified visit) or the end of treatment observation

objectives.name: OBJ2
objectives.text: To document the safety profile of the xanomeline TTS.

endpoints.name: END6
endpoints.text: Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale, total of 11 items [ADAS-Cog (11)] at Weeks 8 and 16

endpoints.name: END7
endpoints.text: Video-referenced Clinician’s Interview-based Impression of Change (CIBIC+) at Weeks 8 and 16

endpoints.name: END8
endpoints.text: Mean Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) from Week 4 to Week 24

objectives.name: OBJ3
objectives.text:
To assess the dose-dependent improvement in behavior. Improved scores on the Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) will indicate improvement in these
areas.

objectives.name: OBJ4
objectives.text: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in activities of daily living. Improved scores on the Disability Assessment for Dementia (DAD) will indicate improvement in these areas (see Attachment LZZT.5).

objectives.name: OBJ5
objectives.text: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in an extended assessment of cognition that integrates attention/concentration tasks. The Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-14 item Cognitive Subscale, hereafter referred to as ADAS-Cog (14), will be used for this assessment (see Attachment LZZT.2).

objectives.name: OBJ6
objectives.text: To assess the treatment response as a function of Apo E genotype.

intercurrentEvents.strategy: Treatment Policy – Continue to measure effect of treatment assignment regardless of interruption.
intercurrentEvents.name: DISTRUPTION
intercurrentEvents.description: The disruption of treatment to the subject

transitionEndRule.name: ENCOUNTER_START_RULE_2
transitionEndRule.text: subject leaves clinic after connection of ambulatory ECG machine

transitionStartRule.name: ENCOUNTER_START_RULE_3
transitionStartRule.text: subject has connection of ambulatory ECG machine removed

activities.name: Study drug
activities.label: Study drug record , Medications dispensed, Medications returned

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX06
eligibilityCriteria.label: Schizophrenia, Bipolar, Ethanol or psychoactive abuse criteria

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX18
eligibilityCriteria.label: Ability to participate in study criteria

studyDesigns.rationale: The discontinuation rate associated with this oral dosing regimen was 58.6% in previous studies, and alternative clinical strategies have been sought to improve tolerance for the compound. To that end, development of a Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) has been initiated.

transitionEndRule.name: ELEMENT_END_RULE_1
transitionEndRule.text: Completion of all screening activities and no more than 2 weeks from informed consent

transitionStartRule.name: ELEMENT_START_RULE_7
transitionStartRule.text: End of last scheduled visit on study (including early termination)

transitionEndRule.name: ELEMENT_END_RULE_7
transitionEndRule.text: Completion of all specified followup activities (which vary on a patient-by-patient basis)

elements.name: EL5
elements.label: High - Middle
elements.description: Xanomeline TTS (adhesive patches) 50 cm2, 54 mg + 25 cm2, 27 mg

transitionStartRule.name: ELEMENT_START_RULE_5
transitionStartRule.text: Administration of first dose (from patches supplied at Visit 4)

transitionStartRule.name: ELEMENT_START_RULE_6
transitionStartRule.text: Administration of first dose (from patches supplied at Visit 12)

analysisPopulations.name: AP_1
analysisPopulations.text: Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer’s Disease.
